info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Gusty Snow Showers and Occasional Squalls this Afternoon... Through about 6 PM, expect occasional bursts of heavier snow from snow showers and squalls. Visibility will be under one mile at times, along with occasional stronger wind gusts up to 40 mph. While most accumulation will be confined to colder surfaces, the heaviest snowfall rates will produce temporary pavement accumulations, especially on bridges, overpasses, ramps, and side streets. After 6 PM, additional bursts of heavier snow are expected to produce a couple inches of accumulation, including on paved surfaces. The snow will linger into the overnight for portions of northwest Indiana. Motorists are advised to drive with caution and leave extra time to reach their destinations.
